results.title: The Pebble and the penguin
results.creator_credit: Colin Mawby, Russell Boland and Don Bluth Productions
results.brief_description: The Full Moon Ceremony, a real-life Adeli Penguin ritual requires that all bachelor penguins present a special pebble to their sweetheart. If she accepts, they are partners for life. Hubie, a shy penguin with a heart of gold, finds a perfect stone to present to his true love Marina. The evil Drake, another admirer casts a plot which sees Hubie expelled from the colony. Luckily as he is cast adrift into the wide world, he meets up with Rocko and together they begin the long journey back home. A life-long friendship develops and at last Hubie gets his girl.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Colin Mawby, Russell Boland and Don Bluth Productions

results.title: Basic instinct (E)
results.creator_credit: Paul Verhoeven, Alan Marshall, Studio Canal+ and Carolco Pictures
results.brief_description: Destined to become a modern classic, Paul Verhoeven’s effort has brought new definition and brilliance to the “femme fatale” of the film noir genre. It is all here, temptation, sex and murder, and all in the guise of a voluptuous beautiful woman. Michael Douglas plays an ex-undercover cop, burnt out and recovering from drug and alcohol addiction when he becomes involved with the investigation of a brutal murder. The prime suspect is a very rich, very beautiful young woman (Sharon Stone) who’s calm and collected exterior belies a predatory and hedonistic soul. Shocking, controversial and explicit, this is not a film for the squeamish. Co-starring George Dzundza.

results.title: Nicholas and Alexandra
results.creator_credit: Franklin J. Schaffner, Sam Spiegel, Horizon (GB), Horizon (US) and Columbia
results.brief_description: A dazzling cast, with Michael Jayston and Janet Suzman playing the lead roles of the ill-fated Czar Nicholas II, and the Czarina Alexandra. Born to be one of the world’s most powerful men, Nicholas ruled millions of people with an empire stretching over one-sixth of the globe. His belief in the Divine Right to rule, made him oblivious to the hardships endured by many of his subjects who were ready to embrace the powerful ideals proposed by Lenin and his followers. The Czarina, in a desperate bid to find a cure for their haemophiliac son, relies heavily on the seductive and mysterious “Mad Monk” Rasputin. Once Lenin and his Bolsheviks gain power, the Royal Family is doomed. “Nicholas and Alexandra” is filled with the pomp and pageantry of history’s great events.

results.title: The Miracle worker
results.creator_credit: Arthur Penn, Fred Coe and Playfilm Productions
results.brief_description: Ann Bancroft and Patty Duke reprised their stage roles and won Academy Awards for their performances in “The Miracle worker.” Blind and deaf from an early childhood illness, Helen Keller lived in a world of solitude where animal instinct and a strong will enabled her to survive the dangers of everyday life. Annie Sullivan, a poor partially blind Irish girl, comes to the Keller mansion to teach Helen. She also has indomitable courage and strength but must struggle not only with Helen’s enormous will, but against a family whose love and pity for their child is so great, it keeps her locked in a prison of darkness and ignorance. A moving film with outstanding performances. Based on the play by William Gibson and the lives of two incredible women.

results.title: Far from the madding crowd
results.creator_credit: John Schlesinger, Joseph Janni, Vic Films and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: This adaptation of Thomas Hardy’s classic novel is also a classic of English cinema. The beautiful Bathsheba (Julie Christie) is determined to consolidate her class position and refuses to accept a poor but devoted herdsman (Alan Bates) as her husband. Using her beauty and charm, she attracts the attention of a rich suitor (Peter Finch), but it is a frivolous womanising soldier (Terence Stamp) who wins her heart. This results in a disastrous marriage which threatens to destroy her fortunes. Schlesinger’s confident direction is beautifully complimented by Nicholas Roeg’s luscious cinematography which highlights the wild, stark grandeur of the south English coast, a perfect visual equivalent to Hardy’s expressive naturalist prose. This film is a passionate love story and a powerful investigation into the emotional treachery of the English class system.

results.title: Muriel's Wedding
results.creator_credit: Jill Bilcock, P.J. Hogan, Jocelyn Moorhouse, Lynda House, Peter Szabo and Associates, Film Victoria and House and Moorhouse Films
results.brief_description: Muriel is a dag, an Abba maniac and an out of place girl who would give anything to be like her nasty friends. In her hunt to find Mr. Right in all the wrong places, Muriel takes a one-way ticket to freedom to find herself.

constellations_other.name: Jill Bilcock
constellations_other.description: An editor’s work often goes unnoticed, but their scene-stitching not only brings the director’s vision to life but sometimes steals the show. One of Australia’s greatest editors, Jill Bilcock, has shaped some of the country’s most memorable screen stories.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Jill Bilcock, P.J. Hogan, Jocelyn Moorhouse, Lynda House, Peter Szabo and Associates, Film Victoria and House and Moorhouse Films
results.description:
Muriel is a dag, an Abba maniac and an out-of-place girl who would give anything to be like her nasty friends. In her hunt to find Mr. Right in all the wrong places, Muriel takes a one-way ticket to freedom to find herself. A bittersweet and much acclaimed film that touches on themes of self-respect, identity and friendship.

Toni Collette gives an inspired performance as Muriel and the supporting cast includes Bill Hunter, Sophie Lee, Jeanie Drynan and Rachel Griffiths.

results.title: The Sentimental bloke
results.creator_credit: F.W. Thring and Efftee Film Productions
results.brief_description: Based on the poem by Bill and Doreen’s courtship, marriage and move to the country, this version of C.J.Dennis’ verse narrative adds subplot in which Bill saves Doreen’s Uncle Jim from an attempted swindle. Stars Cecil Scott Ray Fisher, Tal Ordell and Athol Tier.

results.title: Davy Crockett: king of the wild frontier
results.creator_credit: Norman Foster, Bill Walsh and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: Davy Crockett was a legendary folk hero. Starring Fess Parker as Crockett, the hero fights alligators, battles an Indian Chief in a savage tomahawk duel and fights for freedom at the ill-fated Alamo. Accompanied by his friend George Russell, played by Buddy Ebsen, “Davy Crockett” is a daring adventure of drama, humour and excitement and will remain a colourful portrayal of the frontier.
results.title_for_label: Davy Crockett: king of the wild frontier

results.title: The War of the worlds
results.creator_credit: Byron Haskin, George Pal and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: H.G. Wells’ classic tale about the invasion of the Earth by Martians has inspired and terrified people for many decades. Its translation into film was even more frightening, as audiences felt the panic and saw the destruction, as Martian machines, swan-shaped, ticking and hissing menacingly, destroyed everything in their path. In order to modernise Well’s ideas, the original story was updated to include the atom bomb; ineffectual against the Martians. The film won an Academy Award for special effects. Staring Gene Barry, Ann Robinson and Les Tremayne.

results.title: The Aristocats
results.creator_credit: Wolfgang Reitherman, Winston Hibler and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: Featuring the voices of Phil Harris and Eva Gabor, this Disney animated favourite is filled with lovable characters and “swingin’ music”. When an eccentric millionairess wills her entire estate to her pet cats, her greedy butler abandons them in the French countryside so he can inherit the money himself. Duchess and her three adorable kittens embark on an adventure-filled journey back to Paris, with a street-wise Casanova alley-cat named O’Malley.
